g.text: In a binary search process for every iteration of the process, the search space reduced by a factor of half
In this case, there were k iterations to
arrive at the point where the search space is 1
At this point either the element is present
at that index or not. If it is present, we return
the value of the index or return -1
So assuming a given array does not have the given search element
there will occur 'k' iterations such that
At the kth iteration, the search space would be 1
k = log2(n) => log base 2 of n
